project.description: ## Executes sb_plus Cypher query, exports results to a batched CSV and concatenate all CVS into a single one ##

hudson.model.TextParameterDefinition.name: CYPHER_QUERY
hudson.model.TextParameterDefinition.description:
Cypher query to execute, terminated with semicolon. Optionally, ${ERNIE_ADMIN_POSTGRES} expression is expanded.
Examples:
* ``` // 7) Shortest paths among those that pass through at least one nida_support node from startref1 to endref MATCH p = shortestPath((a {endpoint: 'startref1'})-[*]->(b {endpoint: 'endref'})) WHERE any(x IN nodes(p) WHERE x <> a AND x <> b AND x.nida_support) UNWIND nodes(p) AS path_node WITH DISTINCT path_node AS n RETURN apoc.agg.statistics(n.pagerank); ``` * ``` MATCH (c1:Publication {node_id: 17538003})<--(p)-->(c2:Publication {node_id: 18983824}), (p)-->(c3) RETURN c1.node_id, c2.node_id, c3.node_id, count(p) AS f ORDER BY f DESC; ``` * ``` WITH 'jdbc:postgresql://ernie2/ernie?user=ernie_admin&password=${ERNIE_ADMIN_POSTGRES}' AS db, ' SELECT c1, c2 FROM co_cited_pairs ' AS sql CALL apoc.load.jdbc(db, sql) YIELD row MATCH (c1:Publication {node_id: row.c1})<--(p)-->(c2:Publication {node_id: row.c2}), (p)-->(c3) RETURN c1.node_id, c2.node_id, c3.node_id, count(p) AS f ORDER BY f DESC; ```
hudson.model.TextParameterDefinition.defaultValue: MATCH (c:Publication)-[r:CITES]->(d:Publication) WHERE c.pub_year = 1986 AND c.citation_type = 'ar' AND d.pub_year <=1986 AND c.node_id <> d.node_id WITH c.node_id as scp, count(r) as citations MATCH (a:Publication)<-[r1:CITES]-(c:Publication {node_id: scp})-[r2:CITES]->(b:Publication) WHERE a.node_id <> c.node_id AND b.node_id <> c.node_id AND a.pub_year <= 1986 AND b.pub_year <= 1986 AND a.node_id < b.node_id AND citations >= 5 RETURN a.node_id as cited_1, b.node_id as cited_2;

jenkins.plugins.publish__over__ssh.BapSs.execCommand:
set -e set -o pipefail
# Deploy mkdir -p jenkins_jobs/${JOB_BASE_NAME} cd jenkins_jobs/${JOB_BASE_NAME}
# Run export ERNIE_ADMIN_POSTGRES="${ERNIE_ADMIN_POSTGRES}" echo "$CYPHER_QUERY" | envsubst | cypher-shell --format plain >neo4j_results.csv & pid=$!
# Wait on a background job completion. Query status every 10 minutes. declare -i elapsed=0 # `ps -p ${pid}` works on macOS and CentOS. On both OSes `ps ${pid}` works as well. while ps -p ${pid} >/dev/null; do sleep 1 if ((++elapsed % 600 == 0)); then echo "Waiting for the completion of the main script. $((elapsed / 60))m and counting ..." fi done
# Return the exit code of the terminated background process. This works in Bash 4.4 despite what Bash docs say: # "If neither jobspec nor pid specifies an active child process of the shell, the return status is 127." wait ${pid}
# Collect generated CSV chmod g+w *.csv
# Preserve mode (and other attributes) to make generated file(s) group-writable at the target scp -p *.csv ernie_admin@ernie2:${WORKSPACE}/build
